title: M11 - Guinea & Feather
description: Demonstrates that acceleration due to gravity is not dependent on mass or shape.
infotext: A metal disc and a piece of paper are placed in separate glass tubes. When there is air in the tubes the paper flutters down, while the metal disc drops quickly. When the air is evacuated from the tubes (using a rotary pump), both fall with the same acceleration. The vacuum pump is kept in the gallery of prep room B.

title: M12 - The Gun that never misses
description: This demonstrates the independence of the horizontal and vertical components of motion with a less intuitive setup.

title: M13 - Pop and Drop
description: This demonstrates the independence of the vertical and horizontal components of velocity.

title: M14 - Rolling Cart Catches Ball
description: This demonstrates the independence of the vertical and horizontal components of velocity.

title: M15 - Center of Mass
description: This demonstrates the concept of center of mass.

title: M16 - Principle of Moments
description: This demonstrates the principle of moments.

title: M17 - Center of Gravity
description: This demonstrates the concept of centre of gravity.

title: M18 - Plunger
description: This demonstrates the concept of the center of mass frame.

title: M19 - Double Cone
description: This illustrates the concept of centre of mass with a less intuitive setup.

title: M20 - Inertial Reference Frame
description: Demonstrates the concept of an inertial reference frame.

title: M21 - Ball Falling into cup
description: Demonstrates the absence of the gravitational force in the reference frame of a free-falling system.

title: M22 - Slinky and Stairs
description: Demonstrates several physics principles, including wave motion, Hooke's law, and the effects of gravity.

title: M23 - Falling Chimney
description: Visually demonstrates the effects of rotational inertia and angular acceleration on a rotating object.

title: M30 - Inertia
description: Demonstrates the concept of inertia.

title: M40 - Parallelogram of forces
description: Demonstrates the parallelogram rule for summing vectors.

title: M41 - Resultant of Vectors in 3D
description: This shows that equilibrium of forces takes place in 3 dimensions.

title: M42 - Components of forces
description: Demonstrates the independence of the compenents of forces.

title: M43 - Aeroplane on a String
description: Demonstrates the principles of centripetal force, angular velocity, and rotational kinetic energy.

title: M44 - Tangential motion
description: Demonstrates Newton's First Law.

title: M46 - Sphere's on Inclined Plane
description: demonstrates the principles of conservation of energy, rotational motion, and the relationship between linear and rotational kinetic energy.

title: M47 - Stability of a ladder
description: This is an example of three forces in equilibrium.

title: M48 - Roller on Inclined Plane
description: demonstrates that rolling friction is smaller than sliding friction.

title: M49 - Loaded Block on Inclined Plane
description: Shows in principle how the coefficients of static and kinetic friction can be determined.

title: M50 - Block on Inclined Plane
description: Demonstrates friction.

title: M60 - Varying tension in string
description: Demonstrates varying tension due to centripetal acceleration.

title: M61 - Pulley Systems
description: Demonstrates various pulleys.

title: M62 - Resolution of forces
description: Shows the forces exerted on a block resting on an inclined plane.

title: M66 - Differential Pulley
description: Demonstrates the use of a differential pulley.

title: M67 - Screwjack
description: Illustrates the principle that the work done in lifting a large mass a short distance is equivalent to the work done by a small force over a large distance.

title: M68 - Equal Masses on Double Pulley
description: Illustrates Newton's 1st law in a less intuitive setup.

title: M69 - Adjustable Pulley
description: A pulley with adjustable height.

title: M80 - Trolleys
description: Demonstrates elastic collisions.

title: M81 - Newton's Cradle
description: Demonstrates the conservation of momentum and kinetic energy in elastic collisions.

title: M82 - Mini Newton's Cradle
description: Demonstrates the conservation of momentum and kinetic energy in elastic collisions.

title: M83 - Balls on Rails
description: Demonstrates the conservation of momentum and kinetic energy in elastic collisions.

title: M84 - Inelastic collisions
description: Demonstrates how momentum and kinetic energy are not conserved in inelastic collisions.

title: M85 - Conservation of Momentum
description: Demonstrates conservation of momentum.

title: M86 - Elastic & Inelastic collisions
description: Demonstrates the difference between elastic and inelastic collisions.

title: M87 - Superballs
description: To show objects with high coefficients of restitution.

title: M88- Conservation of Momentum
description: Demonstrates conservaton of momentum with a less intuitive setup.

title: M89- Air Track
description: Demonstrates elastic collisions.

title: M90 - Rocket and Block
description: Demonstrates transfer of energy in elastic and inelastic collisions.

title: M91 - Air Table
description: Demonstrates elastic collisions.

title: M92 - Water Rocket
description: Demonstrates how conservation of momentum is behind the working of rockets.

title: M93 - Balls on Tracks
description: An interesting and somewhat counter-intuitive experiment.

title: M100 - Attwood's Machine
description: An interesting rotational device to demonstrate the principles of motion with constant acceleration.

title: M101 - Crowbar
description: Illustrates the idea of moments.

title: M102 - Rotational Motion
description: Demonstrates various principles of rotational motion.

title: M103 - Conservation of Momentum: Jet Propulsion
description: Demonstrates conservation of momentum.

title: M104 - Centrifugal Force
description: Demonstrates the centripetal force on and centrifugal reaction by a constrained rotated object.

title: M105 - Rotating Candles
description: Demonstrates the interplay between buoyancy, centripetal force, and the properties of a flame.

title: M106 - Large Gyroscope
description: Demonstrates various rotational principles.

title: M108 - Angular Momentum
description: Demonstrates various rotational principles.

title: M109 - Small Gyroscopes
description: Shows the working of gyroscopes.

title: M110 - Rotational Motion
description: Demonstrates the forces resulting from rotational motion.

title: M114 - Celts
description: Demonstrates a unique spin reversal behavior.

title: M120 - Hooke's Law
description: Demonstrates Hooke's Law.

title: M121 - Elastic Limit
description: Demonstrates Hooke's Law and the elastic limit of a material.

title: M122 - Modulus of Rigidity
description: Demonstrates the concepts of torsion and the modulus of rigidity.

title: M130 - Harmonic motion
description: Shows the equivalence of two types of simple harmonic motion.

title: M131 - Cantilever Oscillations
description: Demonstrates free-end oscillations.

title: M132 - Ball on a spring (SHM)
description: Demonstrates Simple Harmonic Motion with a ball on a spring.

title: M133 - Oscillating ball on slope (SHM)
description: Demonstrates Harmonic Motion.

title: M140 - Simple Pendulums
description: Demonstrates Oscillations using a Simple Pendulum.

title: M141 - Period of Oscillation
description: Shows that the period of oscillation is independent of mass but proportional to the length of string.

title: M142 - Whirligig Pendulum
description: Mostly Entertaining.  Shows the conversion energy (like wind or elastic energy in a string) into rotational motion.

title: M143 - Galilieo's Pendulum
description: Shows the transformation from potential energy to kinetic energy and back again.

title: M144 - Ballistic Pendulum
description: Demonstrates conservation of energy.

title: M145 - Probabalistic Pendulum
description: Demonstrates conservation of energy.

title: M146 - Ring Pendulum
description: Shows that a ring and a straight pendulum have the same period if the length of the pendulum is equal to the diameter of the ring.

title: M147 - Different Lengths Pendulum
description: Demonstrates how the period of a pendulum depends on its length.

title: M148 - Oscillating Lamina
description: Demonstrates how changing the moment of inertia affects the frequency of oscillation.

title: M149 - Double Pendulum
description: This is an example of a chaotic system that is highly sensitive to initial conditions.

title: M150 - Two Rod Pendulums
description: A comparison of the acclerations of pendulums with and without masses attached to their lower ends.

title: M151 - Giant Pendulum
description: This demonstrates conservation of energy in a dramatic way.

title: M160 - Wilberforce Pendulum
description: Shows the normal modes of a Wilberforce pendulum.

title: M161 - Adjustable Wilberforce Pendulum
description: This demonstrates the effect of changing the moment of inertia on the beat frequency of a Wilberforce pendulum.

title: M162 - Simple Coupled Oscillator
description: Demonstration of a coupled oscillator.

title: M163 - Oscillator Coupled by Mass
description: Demonstration of coupled oscillators.

title: M164 - Oscillator Coupled by Rod
description: Demonstration of coupled oscillators.

title: M165 - Oscillator Coupled by Bar
description: Demonstration of coupled oscillators.

title: M166 - Pair of Wilberforce Pendulums
description: Demonstration of coupled oscillators.

title: M170 - Resonance
description: Demonstration resonance.

title: M171 - Resonance Oscillations
description: Demonstration resonance.

title: M172 - Driven Oscillations
description: Demonstration resonance.

title: M180 - Chemical balance
description: Used to illustrate the sensitivity and stability of a chemical balance.

title: M181 - Large Vernier Callipers
description: Large model of Vernier calipers.

title: M182 - Large Slide Rule
description: A large slide rule.

title: M183 - Model of a Vernier Scale
description: For teaching measurement and how to read a vernier scale.

title: M184 - Model Micrometer Screwgauge
description: Large model of a Micrometer Screwguage.

title: M185 - Spherometer
description: Large model of a spherometer.

title: M186 - Vector Arrows
description: Use them to demonstrate vectors in three dimensions.
